trans-unit.source: Determines whether an assembly belongs to a code group by testing its zone of origin.
This class cannot be inherited.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition"></xref> class with the zone that determines membership.
The <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref> for which to test.
The zone parameter is not a valid .
Determines whether the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition.
This membership condition tests only the <xref:System.Security.Policy.Zone> evidence object.
The evidence set against which to make the test.
`true` if the specified evidence satisfies the membership condition; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Creates an equivalent copy of the membership condition.
A new, identical copy of the current membership condition.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Determines whether the zone from the specified object is equivalent to the zone contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition"></xref>.
The object to compare to the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition"></xref>.
`true` if the zone from the specified object is equivalent to the zone contained in the current <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property for the current object or the specified object is `null`.

The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property for the current object or the specified object is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The e parameter is `null`.
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
The policy level context used to resolve named permission set references.
The e parameter is `null`.
The e parameter is not a valid membership condition element.
Gets the hash code for the current membership condition.
The hash code for the current membership condition.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Gets or sets the zone for which the membership condition tests.
Refer to the <xref:System.Security.SecurityZone> enumeration for a definition of specific zones.
The zone for which the membership condition tests.
The value is `null`.
An attempt is made to set <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> to an invalid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Creates and returns a string representation of the membership condition.
A string representation of the state of the membership condition.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state with the specified <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyLevel"></xref>.
The policy level context for resolving named permission set references.
An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Security.Policy.ZoneMembershipCondition.SecurityZone"></xref> property is not a valid <xref href="System.Security.SecurityZone"></xref>.
